attributes.action: Ban adult entry charges to children entertainment venues
attributes.additional_details: The extortionate pricing for adult entry is stopping many families being able to afford to take their child/ren to fun sociable places. Adults are not going to these places to participate, we are only going to take the children. But we are being limited on where we can afford to go as everywhere is charging unnecessarily for adults.
attributes.background: I would like parliament to ban places charging for adult entry on childrens venues such as soft plays, farms and activity centres. If it is a child based activity with no adult involvement, just being a spectator then the entry charge should not be legally allowed.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about prices of entry for child activity venues are a matter for individual businesses, not the UK Government or Parliament.
